org.openimaj.feature

Enum ByteFVComparison

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<ByteFVComparison>
      • org.openimaj.feature.ByteFVComparison
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Comparable<ByteFVComparison>, ByteFVComparator, FVComparator<ByteFV>, org.openimaj.util.comparator.DistanceComparator<ByteFV>

    public enum ByteFVComparison
extends Enum<ByteFVComparison>
implements ByteFVComparator
    Comparison/distance methods for ByteFV objects.
    Author:
    Jonathon Hare (jsh2@ecs.soton.ac.uk)

    • Enum Constant Summary

      Enum Constants 
      Enum Constant and Description
      ARCCOS
      The arccosine of the cosine similarity
      BHATTACHARYYA
      Bhattacharyya distance d(H1,H2) = sqrt( 1 - (1 / sqrt(sumI(H1(I)) * sumI(H2(I))) ) * sumI( sqrt(H1(I) * H2(I)) ) )
      CHI_SQUARE
      Chi-squared distance d(H1,H2) = 0.5 * sumI[(H1(I)-H2(I))^2 / (H1(I)+H2(I))]
      CITY_BLOCK
      City-block (L1) distance d(H1,H2) = sumI( abs(H1(I)-H2(I)) )
      CORRELATION
      Correlation d(H1,H2) = sumI( H'1(I) * H'2(I) ) / sqrt( sumI[H'1(I)2]^2 * sumI[H'2(I)^2] ) where H'k(I) = Hk(I) - (1/N) * sumJ( Hk(J) ); N=number of FeatureVector bins
      COSINE_DIST
      Cosine distance (-COSINE_SIM)
      COSINE_SIM
      Cosine similarity (sim of 1 means identical) d(H1,H2)=sumI(H1(I) * H2(I))) / (sumI(H1(I)^2) sumI(H2(I)^2))
      EUCLIDEAN
      Euclidean distance d(H1,H2) = Math.sqrt( sumI( (H1(I)-H2(I))^2 ) )
      HAMMING
      Hamming Distance d(H1,H2) = sumI(H1(I) == H2(I) ? 1 : 0)
      INTERSECTION
      Histogram intersection d(H1,H2) = sumI( min(H1(I), H2(I)) )
      JACCARD_DISTANCE
      Jaccard distance.
      PACKED_HAMMING
      Hamming Distance for packed bit strings d(H1,H2) = sumI(H1(I) == H2(I) ? 1 : 0)
      SUM_SQUARE
      Sum-square distance d(H1,H2) = sumI( (H1(I)-H2(I))^2 )
      SYMMETRIC_KL_DIVERGENCE
      The symmetric Kullback-Leibler divergence.

        public static final ByteFVComparison EUCLIDEAN
        Euclidean distance d(H1,H2) = Math.sqrt( sumI( (H1(I)-H2(I))^2 ) )

      • CORRELATION

        public static final ByteFVComparison CORRELATION
        Correlation d(H1,H2) = sumI( H'1(I) * H'2(I) ) / sqrt( sumI[H'1(I)2]^2 * sumI[H'2(I)^2] ) where H'k(I) = Hk(I) - (1/N) * sumJ( Hk(J) ); N=number of FeatureVector bins

      • CHI_SQUARE

        public static final ByteFVComparison CHI_SQUARE
        Chi-squared distance d(H1,H2) = 0.5 * sumI[(H1(I)-H2(I))^2 / (H1(I)+H2(I))]

      • INTERSECTION

        public static final ByteFVComparison INTERSECTION
        Histogram intersection d(H1,H2) = sumI( min(H1(I), H2(I)) )

      • BHATTACHARYYA

        public static final ByteFVComparison BHATTACHARYYA
        Bhattacharyya distance d(H1,H2) = sqrt( 1 - (1 / sqrt(sumI(H1(I)) * sumI(H2(I))) ) * sumI( sqrt(H1(I) * H2(I)) ) )

      • HAMMING

        public static final ByteFVComparison HAMMING
        Hamming Distance d(H1,H2) = sumI(H1(I) == H2(I) ? 1 : 0)

      • PACKED_HAMMING

        public static final ByteFVComparison PACKED_HAMMING
        Hamming Distance for packed bit strings d(H1,H2) = sumI(H1(I) == H2(I) ? 1 : 0)

      • CITY_BLOCK

        public static final ByteFVComparison CITY_BLOCK
        City-block (L1) distance d(H1,H2) = sumI( abs(H1(I)-H2(I)) )

      • COSINE_SIM

        public static final ByteFVComparison COSINE_SIM
        Cosine similarity (sim of 1 means identical) d(H1,H2)=sumI(H1(I) * H2(I))) / (sumI(H1(I)^2) sumI(H2(I)^2))

      • COSINE_DIST

        public static final ByteFVComparison COSINE_DIST
        Cosine distance (-COSINE_SIM)

      • ARCCOS

        public static final ByteFVComparison ARCCOS
        The arccosine of the cosine similarity

      • SYMMETRIC_KL_DIVERGENCE

        public static final ByteFVComparison SYMMETRIC_KL_DIVERGENCE
        The symmetric Kullback-Leibler divergence. Vectors must only contain positive values; internally they will be converted to double arrays and normalised to sum to unit length.

      • JACCARD_DISTANCE

        public static final ByteFVComparison JACCARD_DISTANCE
        Jaccard distance. Converts each vector to a set for comparison.
